Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class DatagramServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.DatagramConnector
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.DatagramServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cluster, DNSServer
    public abstract class DatagramServer
extends DatagramConnector
implements ChannelHandler
    A server that binds to a UDP port and handles datagrams.

    Unlike TCP servers, a DatagramServer does not create separate connection objects for each remote address. Instead, the server itself receives all datagrams and handles them directly via the receive(ByteBuffer, InetSocketAddress) method.

    Subclasses implement receive(ByteBuffer, InetSocketAddress) to handle incoming datagrams and can use send(ByteBuffer, InetSocketAddress) to send responses.

    For DTLS-secured connections, encryption and decryption are handled transparently. Per-remote-address DTLS session state is maintained internally.

    Example usage: 

    
 public class SimpleDNSServer extends DatagramServer {
     @Override
     protected int getPort() {
         return 53;
     }

     @Override
     protected void receive(ByteBuffer data, InetSocketAddress source) {
         DNSMessage query = DNSMessage.parse(data);
         DNSMessage response = resolve(query);
         send(response.serialize(), source);
     }

     @Override
     protected String getDescription() {
         return "dns";
     }
 }
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

      • configureDTLSEngine

        protected void configureDTLSEngine​(javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine)
        Description copied from class: DatagramConnector
        Configures DTLS engine settings. Default implementation sets useClientMode to false (server mode). Subclasses can override to add additional DTLS configuration.
        Overrides:
        configureDTLSEngine in class DatagramConnector
        Parameters:
        engine - the DTLS engine to configure

      • getProtocolFamily

        protected java.net.ProtocolFamily getProtocolFamily()
        Returns the protocol family for the datagram channel.

        Override this method to specify IPv4 or IPv6 explicitly. The default implementation returns null, which uses the system default.

        Returns:
        the protocol family, or null for system default

      • configureChannel

        protected void configureChannel​(java.nio.channels.DatagramChannel channel)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Called after the channel is opened but before it is registered with the selector.

        Override this method to perform additional channel configuration such as joining multicast groups or setting socket options.

        Parameters:
        channel - the datagram channel
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if configuration fails

      • receive

        protected abstract void receive​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data,
                                java.net.InetSocketAddress source)
        Called when a datagram is received. For DTLS connections, the data is already decrypted.
        Parameters:
        data - the datagram payload
        source - the source address of the datagram

      • send

        public void send​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data,
                 java.net.InetSocketAddress dest)
        Sends a datagram to the specified destination. For DTLS connections, the data is automatically encrypted.
        Parameters:
        data - the datagram payload
        dest - the destination address
